Description: Define deterministic onboarding lifecycle states, transitions, failure classes, and rollback checkpoints for host+wallet+policy setup.
Acceptance Criteria: State diagram and transition table are published; every transition has explicit success/failure criteria; invalid transitions are rejected in tests.

Description: Detect host profile, config locations, and runtime prerequisites across Windows/macOS/Linux with stable diagnostics.
Acceptance Criteria: CLI identifies host config path candidates and selects one deterministically; missing prerequisites produce actionable remediation output.

Description: Implement secure acquisition and validation of required API tokens and tenant context during onboarding.
Acceptance Criteria: Onboarding validates token scopes before proceeding; secrets are never logged; invalid tokens fail with stable error codes.

Description: Ship `settld onboard --host openclaw` orchestration that runs host wiring, wallet setup, policy setup, and smoke verification.
Acceptance Criteria: Single command completes full setup in success path and outputs ready summary; failures include resumable step markers and deterministic exit codes.

Description: Record step-by-step onboarding events with idempotency keys to allow safe resume and audit visibility.
Acceptance Criteria: Repeated onboarding invocations resume from last consistent checkpoint; journal exposes step status, timestamps, and error classification.

Description: Provide `settld onboard rollback` to unwind partial setup safely by host, tenant, wallet, and policy components.
Acceptance Criteria: Rollback removes or deactivates created artifacts according to plan; dry-run mode reports exact actions; rollback actions are auditable.

Description: Emit readiness score and required fixes after onboarding to standardize support and launch gates.
Acceptance Criteria: Output includes readiness score, failing checks, and fix commands; score computation is deterministic for same system state.

Description: Specify adapter contract for wallet provisioning, reserve/escrow operations, signing, and capability declarations.
Acceptance Criteria: Interface document defines required methods, error taxonomy, and capability flags; contract tests fail for incomplete adapters.

Description: Build Circle adapter with testnet/mainnet modes, spend+escrow provisioning, reserve calls, and balance checks.
Acceptance Criteria: Adapter provisions wallets and performs authorize/settle flow in test harness; provider errors map to normalized Settld codes.

Description: Build Privy adapter using same interface with parity behaviors for provisioning, authorization, and receipts.
Acceptance Criteria: Privy adapter passes contract tests and end-to-end smoke; runtime can select Privy without code-path changes.

Description: Build external/BYO wallet bridge for delegated authorization and receipt capture when wallets are managed outside Settld.
Acceptance Criteria: External adapter supports non-custodial flow with signed attestations; missing attestations fail closed.

Description: Create registry exposing provider capabilities, limits, required env vars, and compliance flags to onboarding UX.
Acceptance Criteria: Registry returns normalized capability profile for each adapter; onboarding renders only valid options for selected environment.

Description: Implement recommendation logic to pick default provider based on user intent, environment, and compliance constraints.
Acceptance Criteria: Engine returns ranked provider options with rationale; deterministic recommendation for same input context.

Description: Provision spend wallet and baseline funding checks via selected adapter during onboarding.
Acceptance Criteria: Spend wallet ID/address are persisted and verified; insufficient funding state is detected and surfaced with remediation steps.

Description: Provision escrow wallet and link reserve policy bindings for authorization and settlement flows.
Acceptance Criteria: Escrow wallet is created and linked to policy context; authorize->verify->receipt flow references escrow linkage correctly.

Description: Define schema for versioned policy packs, constraints, profile metadata, signatures, and compatibility ranges.
Acceptance Criteria: Schema and examples are published; validator rejects malformed packs with stable reason codes.

Description: Build compiler that validates packs, resolves defaults, computes policy fingerprints, and emits runtime-ready policy objects.
Acceptance Criteria: Compiler output is deterministic; same input yields same policy fingerprint and canonical JSON.

Description: Ship starter packs for procurement, marketing, research, and hiring with safe caps and escalation defaults.
Acceptance Criteria: At least four starter packs are installable; each includes simulation scenarios and expected outcomes.

Summary: Add policy profile selector to onboarding
Description: Add interactive profile selection with preview of limits, escalation routes, and required approvals.
Acceptance Criteria: Onboarding displays profile comparison and selected pack summary; selected pack is persisted and applied.

Description: Provide `settld policy simulate` for dry-run evaluation of planned actions against chosen pack and runtime context.
Acceptance Criteria: CLI returns decision and reason code for sample payloads; results match runtime decision engine outputs.

Description: Provide tooling to diff policy versions and generate migration advisories before applying updates.
Acceptance Criteria: Diff output includes changed constraints and risk tags; migration command blocks unsafe downgrades by default.

Summary: Implement policy pack signing and provenance
Description: Sign policy packs and verify provenance before install to block tampered or untrusted policy artifacts.
Acceptance Criteria: Unsigned or invalidly signed packs are rejected; install logs include signer identity and digest evidence.

Description: Define command contract between OpenClaw and Settld for non-interactive onboarding invocation and status exchange.
Acceptance Criteria: Contract defines command inputs/outputs, error codes, and profile handling; contract tests cover schema compatibility.

Description: Implement `openclaw setup settld` bridge that invokes Settld onboarding with profile-aware defaults.
Acceptance Criteria: OpenClaw command triggers Settld flow and returns readiness summary; command supports interactive and non-interactive modes.

Description: Write host config updates for OpenClaw profiles and validate MCP server registration for selected profile.
Acceptance Criteria: Installer writes MCP config to active profile path and verifies `settld.about` probe succeeds.

Summary: Build OpenClaw health check and doctor hooks
Description: Add post-install health checks and remediation guidance integrated with OpenClaw doctor flow.
Acceptance Criteria: Health check reports host wiring, auth validity, and wallet status; doctor command provides one-step fixes where possible.

Description: Expose step-level progress, blockers, and retry guidance in OpenClaw TUI for onboarding operations.
Acceptance Criteria: TUI shows current step and completion states; failed steps include retry action and linked logs.

Description: Add commands to recover broken Settld-OpenClaw integration without full reset.
Acceptance Criteria: Recovery command revalidates config, rotates broken creds, and restores working probe without reinstalling OpenClaw.

Summary: Enforce policy fingerprint binding in authorization
Description: Require policy fingerprint/version consistency between gate, passport, and runtime policy resolution paths.
Acceptance Criteria: Authorization rejects mismatched policy refs with stable codes; matching refs proceed and are recorded in receipts.

Description: Validate provider decision token signatures, scopes, and expiry for each authorization path.
Acceptance Criteria: Invalid/expired decision tokens are denied; valid decisions produce deterministic authorization state transitions.

Summary: Enrich receipts with wallet lifecycle evidence
Description: Attach provider-specific authorization/reserve/settlement evidence references to receipt records.
Acceptance Criteria: Receipts include normalized provider evidence refs; verifier confirms refs are present and hash-bound.

Description: Provide replay endpoint that reconstructs escalation timeline and decision replay report deterministically.
Acceptance Criteria: Replay report is byte-stable for same event set; includes all escalation events and final decision summary.

Description: Export immutable bundles for onboarding, policy, authorization, escalation, and receipt evidence per tenant.
Acceptance Criteria: Export includes canonical manifests and signatures; offline verifier passes in strict mode.

Summary: Implement verifier report for onboarding runs
Description: Produce independent verifier output for each onboarding run to confirm trust path integrity.
Acceptance Criteria: Verifier report includes pass/fail and reason codes for each trust primitive; report artifacts are attached to run history.

Description: Define data model for policy packs/connectors, versions, trust metadata, and compatibility constraints.
Acceptance Criteria: Domain model and APIs are documented; package resolution rules are deterministic.

Description: Implement publish flow with validation, signing checks, metadata extraction, and immutable version registration.
Acceptance Criteria: Publishing enforces schema/signature checks; successful publishes are immutable and queryable by version.

Summary: Build package install and upgrade manager
Description: Implement install/upgrade/uninstall lifecycle for marketplace packages with dependency and compatibility checks.
Acceptance Criteria: Install manager resolves dependencies and blocks incompatible packages; operations are idempotent and auditable.

Description: Compute trust scores from signature provenance, install outcomes, and policy/runtime safety signals.
Acceptance Criteria: Trust score is computed for every package version; scoring inputs are transparent and exportable.

Description: Track package usage and attribution events for future monetization/revenue-share without affecting runtime determinism.
Acceptance Criteria: Usage attribution records are written for install/use events; reports aggregate by package/version/tenant.

Summary: Build marketplace browse and search surfaces
Description: Expose API and CLI browse/search/install flows for packages with trust and compatibility filters.
Acceptance Criteria: Users can list and filter packages by host/wallet compatibility and trust score; install command works end-to-end.

Description: Move onboarding workers to short-lived scoped tokens and eliminate static long-lived admin credentials in setup paths.
Acceptance Criteria: Onboarding uses short-lived scoped tokens only; static admin token path is disabled in production mode.

Description: Add optional HSM/KMS-backed signing path for provider and policy signing operations.
Acceptance Criteria: HSM/KMS mode signs required artifacts without local private-key exposure; fallback behavior is explicit and auditable.

Summary: Generate SBOM for adapters and packs
Description: Produce and publish SBOM artifacts for wallet adapters and installable policy/connector packages.
Acceptance Criteria: CI emits SBOM for each release artifact; SBOM files are attached to release bundle and verifiable.

Description: Require trusted signatures for adapter binaries/modules before activation in runtime.
Acceptance Criteria: Unsigned or untrusted adapters cannot be loaded; verification failures emit stable error codes and alerts.

Description: Detect anomalous spend behavior, policy bypass patterns, and adapter drift in real time.
Acceptance Criteria: Anomaly rules trigger alerts with severity and context; false-positive tuning controls are documented.

Description: Provide operator kill-switch to pause onboarding/authz flows per tenant/provider/policy when abuse is detected.
Acceptance Criteria: Kill-switch blocks targeted flows within 60s and records signed operator action artifacts for audit.

Summary: Implement evidence retention and redaction controls
Description: Apply tenant-level retention windows and redaction policies for evidence bundles and operational logs.
Acceptance Criteria: Retention and redaction policies execute automatically; policy violations are surfaced in compliance reports.

Summary: Map controls to SOC2 GDPR HIPAA baseline
Description: Create control matrix and evidence mapping for major compliance frameworks relevant to autonomous spend trust systems.
Acceptance Criteria: Control matrix maps each requirement to implemented controls and evidence artifact paths; gaps are explicitly tracked.

Description: Define service level objectives for onboarding success latency, authorization reliability, and escalation response.
Acceptance Criteria: SLOs are documented with target/error budgets and measurement queries; dashboards include SLO burn indicators.

Description: Add trace propagation through onboarding orchestrator, wallet adapters, policy runtime, and evidence writer.
Acceptance Criteria: Single trace links all onboarding sub-steps; failures can be root-caused from trace view without manual correlation.

Summary: Implement metrics and dashboards for setup funnel
Description: Instrument onboarding funnel and runtime reliability metrics with tenant/provider/policy dimensions.
Acceptance Criteria: Dashboard shows step conversion rates and p50/p95 latencies; metrics are available for alerts and weekly reviews.

Summary: Implement alert routing and severity policy
Description: Define and configure alert routes and paging policy for onboarding, wallet, policy, and evidence failures.
Acceptance Criteria: Critical alerts page on-call with runbook links; low-severity alerts route to async channels only.

Summary: Run chaos drills for wallet adapter failures
Description: Execute scheduled chaos scenarios for provider outage, latency spikes, and partial provisioning failures.
Acceptance Criteria: Chaos drills run in controlled environments; each drill produces pass/fail report with remediation actions.

Summary: Implement blue-green rollout with auto rollback
Description: Deploy onboarding/runtime services with blue-green strategy and rollback trigger tied to SLO and gate failures.
Acceptance Criteria: Release pipeline rolls back automatically when rollback conditions are met; rollback event is logged and notified.

Description: Create automated host certification matrix covering Codex, Claude, Cursor, and OpenClaw onboarding compatibility.
Acceptance Criteria: Matrix tests run in CI and produce machine-readable report; failures block release gate.

Description: Create adapter contract tests that every wallet provider implementation must pass before release.
Acceptance Criteria: Circle/Privy/External adapters pass mandatory suite; failing adapter cannot be selected by onboarding.

Description: Create harness that provisions tenant+wallet+policy and runs full authorize/escalate/verify/receipt path on testnet.
Acceptance Criteria: Harness produces deterministic artifacts and pass/fail report; run is reproducible with same seed inputs.

Description: Create load tests for concurrent onboarding executions and measure contention/idempotency behavior under stress.
Acceptance Criteria: Load tests run at target concurrency and report success/error rates; no data corruption under contention.

Summary: Enforce release gate for evidence parity
Description: Add release gate ensuring evidence/export/verifier parity between staging and production candidate builds.
Acceptance Criteria: Release fails when verifier parity checks diverge; gate output includes exact mismatch diagnostics.

Description: Publish minimal path from install to first verified receipt with copy-paste commands and expected outputs.
Acceptance Criteria: Quickstart validated by fresh user path in under 5 minutes; docs include troubleshooting for top three failure modes.

Summary: Publish onboarding architecture and threat model
Description: Document architecture, trust boundaries, attack surfaces, and mitigation controls for onboarding+wallet+policy plane.
Acceptance Criteria: Docs include diagrams and abuse paths; security review sign-off is captured in repo.

Description: Document incident response steps for onboarding failures, wallet outages, and escalation system degradation.
Acceptance Criteria: Runbook includes triage, mitigation, rollback, and communication templates; on-call can execute without tribal knowledge.

Summary: Publish policy and wallet setup templates
Description: Ship reusable templates for common combinations of host, wallet provider, and policy profile.
Acceptance Criteria: Templates are installable and simulation-tested; each template includes expected decisions and limits.

Description: Add interactive setup walkthrough on docs site with command copy buttons and expected verification checkpoints.
Acceptance Criteria: Walkthrough tracks completion steps and links to run diagnostics; user can complete setup without external docs.

Description: Define ICP, qualification criteria, and disqualification rules for design-partner pilots.
Acceptance Criteria: Rubric defines required signals and acceptance thresholds; every pilot candidate is scored before onboarding.

Description: Implement structured pilot onboarding checklist with owner handoffs and SLA for setup support.
Acceptance Criteria: Checklist and SLA workflow are operational; each pilot has tracked setup progress and blocker ownership.

Description: Instrument activation funnel from setup start to first verified receipt and first successful escalation resolution.
Acceptance Criteria: Dashboard reports conversion by step and cohort; metrics are available daily with <24h lag.

Description: Generate weekly scorecards for reliability, adoption, and support burden per pilot account.
Acceptance Criteria: Weekly scorecards are generated automatically and include trend deltas and risk flags.

Summary: Run design-partner pilots and capture evidence
Description: Execute five design-partner pilots end-to-end and capture adoption/reliability evidence for launch decision.
Acceptance Criteria: At least five pilots complete setup and run production-like scenarios; outcome evidence is stored in launch packet.

Summary: Build launch readiness packet and rollout plan
Description: Compile technical, security, reliability, and pilot evidence into go/no-go packet with staged rollout plan.
Acceptance Criteria: Go/no-go packet includes signed gate results, pilot outcomes, rollback plan, and staged rollout schedule.
